docs.title: Signal Editor
docs.text: A GUI application for working with large biosignal datasets. Built using Python and PySide6.

docs.title: Research papers
docs.text: • Elgendi, M., Norton, I., Brearley, M., Abbott, D., & Schuurmans, D. (2013). Systolic peak detection in acceleration photoplethysmograms measured from emergency responders in tropical conditions. PloS One, 8(10), e76585. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0076585

docs.title: Menu Bar
docs.text: The menu bar is the topmost part of the window. It contains the following items:

docs.title: File
docs.text: The file menu contains commands for opening and closing files or viewing a file's metadata.

docs.title: View
docs.text: The view menu contains commands for toggling the visibility of the Section List, Parameter Inputs and Status Log docks.

docs.title: Plot
docs.text: The plot menu contains commands for removing or finding peaks in a selected area, toggling automatic y-axis scaling and showing an overview of the available sections in the base plot.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: The settings menu contains commands for showing the Settings dialog.

docs.title: Help
docs.text: The help menu contains commands for showing the User Guide, About and About Qt windows. Also allows toggling the What's This mode, in which contextual help is shown when clicking on an UI element.

docs.title: Loading Data
docs.text:
To load data into the application, use the Open File button in the File menu or on the Import page, then select the file you want to load.

The selected file is searched for available columns or channels of data by either reading the available metadata (EDF files) or scanning the first few rows of the file. If any are found, their names are made available for selection in the Signal Data and Additional Data fields.

The sampling rate of the data is also retrieved from the file's metadata (EDF files). For other file formats, an attempt is made to detect the sampling rate automatically. If the attempt fails, the user is prompted to enter the sampling rate manually.

docs.title: EDF (European Data Format)
docs.text:
EDF files are read using the mne library. The full metadata can be viewed in the Additional Metadata tab of the File Metadata dialog (open by clicking on the File Metadata button in the Toolbar or the File menu).

  • CSV / TSV / TXT
  • XLSX
  • Arrow IPC / Feather (v2)
  • HDF5 result files (created by the application)

docs.title: Standardization
docs.text: Performs a standardization of data (Z-scoring), i.e., centering and scaling, so that the data is expressed in terms of standard deviation (i.e., mean = 0, SD = 1) or Median Absolute Deviance (median = 0, MAD = 1). The latter is more robust to outliers. The rolling version of this standardization is available only for the standard deviation approach, since calculating rolling median's for signals with over 100k samples will take way too long.
